message_1:
Solve the system of linear equations using substitution method:

2x + 3y = 13

4x - 5y = -19
message_2:
First, we will solve one of the equations for one variable. Let's solve the first equation for x:

2x + 3y = 13

2x = 13 - 3y

x = (13 - 3y) / 2

Now, we will substitute this expression for x into the second equation:

4x - 5y = -19

4((13 - 3y) / 2) - 5y = -19

2(13 - 3y) - 5y = -19

26 - 6y - 5y = -19

-11y = -45

y = 45 / 11

Now that we have the value for y, we can substitute it back into the expression for x:

x = (13 - 3y) / 2

x = (13 - 3(45 / 11)) / 2

x = (13 - 135 / 11) / 2

x = (-2 / 11) / 2

x = -1 / 11

So the solution to the system of linear equations is:

x = -1/11, y = 45/11
